item.title: The tyranny of numbers
item.description: A problem I keep coming back to is one of the first things one notices when trying to analyse social science data; it is hard to come up with any concrete conclusion – or, conversely, it is easy to make up any story you want, and have your data confirm it. It’s trivial to keep adding confounders and claiming that “aha”, this is confounded by X, which behaves like this and that, which you did not take into account when doing the study.
